intro: Stoechas pedunculata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Stoechas pedunculata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
